title: Inflection points from several second derivatives

content.description:
<math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <msup> <mrow> </mrow> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mi>x</mi> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@490D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <msup> <mrow> </mrow> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mi>x</mi> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4AB5@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

<math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>h</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <msup> <mrow></mrow> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4AC1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

The twice-differentiable functions f, g, and h have second derivatives given above.
content.question: Which of the functions f, g, and h have a graph with exactly two points of inflection?

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
